alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 6:31PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 700 PM MDT... At 629 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles east of Buffalo, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain of around one-half inch and pea sized hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid water runoff in ditches and draws. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Johnson County. The heaviest rain has moved south to Tipperary Road and Thompson Creek Road as new thunderstorms have developed. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
